Sheath border color: the border of the leaf sheath is dark, or with a narrow white edge
Sheath color: the leaf sheath is mainly black
Sheathes on older stems: the leaf sheathes fall off in older stems
Cone tip shape: the tip of the spore cone has a small, sharp point
Spore form: the spores are green and spherical
Branches: there are no branches off the main stem
Stem color: the aerial stem color is green
Stem cross-section: more than half the stem diameter is occupied by the hollow central cavity
Stem differences: the vegetative and reproductive stems are similar in appearance
Stem texture: the stem feels fairly to very rough
